intro: Alnus incana subsp. kolaensis, commonly known as the Kola alder, is a shrub or small tree native to West Africa. It is characterized by its deciduous leaves, which are typically ovate to elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are adapted for wind dispersal. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. This species plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
